page.title: 20Fenton Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council is served by six members although seven are allowed. If, when an election occurs, more than seven wish to stand, the cost of the election is stood by the Parish Council. Meetings are held once a month and deal mainly with planning applications and any complaints from residents. Even though it is only a small cog in a big wheel, Councillors feel that providing they can put the argument across well, notice will be taken of it by the appropriate authority. Some Councillors feel that not enough residents take advantage of the Parish Council and that a few are apathetic towards it. This is reflected in the poor attendece of villagers at the monthly meetings which they can attend as spectators. INFORMATION COMPILED BY KETTLETHORPE AND DISTRICT WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.
